35
36#ifndef UTIL_RANDOM_H
37#define UTIL_RANDOM_H
38
39/**
40 * \file
41 * Thread safe random functions. Similar to arc4random() with an explicit
42 * initialisation routine.
43 */
44
45/**
46 * random state structure.
47 */
48struct ub_randstate;
49
50/**
51 * Initialize the system randomness. Obtains entropy from the system
52 * before a chroot or privilege makes it unavailable.
53 * You do not have to call this, otherwise ub_initstate does so.
54 * @param seed: seed value to create state (if no good entropy is found).
55 */
56void ub_systemseed(unsigned int seed);
57
58/**
59 * Initialize a random generator state for use
60 * @param seed: seed value to create state contents.
61 * (ignored for arc4random).
62 * @param from: if not NULL, the seed is taken from this random structure.
63 * can be used to seed random states via a parent-random-state that
64 * is itself seeded with entropy.
65 * @return new state or NULL alloc failure.
66 */
67struct ub_randstate* ub_initstate(unsigned int seed,
68 struct ub_randstate* from);
69
70/**
71 * Generate next random number from the state passed along.
72 * Thread safe, so random numbers are repeatable.
73 * @param state: must have been initialised with ub_initstate.
74 * @return: random 31 bit value.
75 */
76long int ub_random(struct ub_randstate* state);
77
78/**
79 * Generate random number between 0 and x-1. No modulo bias.
80 * @param state: must have been initialised with ub_initstate.
81 * @param x: an upper limit. not (negative or zero). must be smaller than 2**31.
82 * @return: random value between 0..x-1. Possibly more than one
83 * random number is picked from the random stream to satisfy this.
84 */
85long int ub_random_max(struct ub_randstate* state, long int x);
86
87/**
88 * Delete the random state.
89 * @param state: to delete.
90 */
91void ub_randfree(struct ub_randstate* state);
92
93#endif /* UTIL_RANDOM_H */
94
